commands.name: az network private-dns record-set mx add-record
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set mx add-record --exchange
                                                --preference
                                                --record-set-name
                                                --resource-group
                                                --zone-name
examples:
az network private-dns record-set mx add-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -e mail.mysite.com -p 10

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set mx create
commands.summary: Create an empty MX record set.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set mx create --name
                                            --resource-group
                                            --zone-name
                                            [--metadata]
                                            [--ttl]
examples: az network private-dns record-set mx create -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set mx delete
commands.summary: Delete an MX record set and all associated records.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set mx delete [--ids]
                                            [--if-match]
                                            [--name]
                                            [--resource-group]
                                            [--subscription]
                                            [--yes]
                                            [--zone-name]
examples: az network private-dns record-set mx delete -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set mx list
commands.summary: List all MX record sets in a zone.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set mx list --resource-group
                                          --zone-name
                                          [--max-items]
                                          [--next-token]
examples: az network private-dns record-set mx list -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set mx remove-record
commands.summary: Remove an MX record from its record set.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set mx remove-record --exchange
                                                   --preference
                                                   --record-set-name
                                                   --resource-group
                                                   --zone-name
                                                   [--keep-empty-record-set]
examples:
az network private-dns record-set mx remove-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -e mail.mysite.com -p 10

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set mx show
commands.summary: Get the details of an MX record set.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set mx show [--ids]
                                          [--name]
                                          [--resource-group]
                                          [--subscription]
                                          [--zone-name]
examples: az network private-dns record-set mx show -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set mx update
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set mx update [--add]
                                            [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                            [--ids]
                                            [--if-match]
                                            [--metadata]
                                            [--name]
                                            [--remove]
                                            [--resource-group]
                                            [--set]
                                            [--subscription]
                                            [--zone-name]
examples: az network private-dns record-set mx update -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet --metadata owner=WebTeam
